intro: Allosorus angustifolius var. minor, commonly known as the narrow-leaved allosorus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, feather-like leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. This variety is often found in moist, calcareous soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
